references.paper_title: k-means++: the advantages of careful seeding
references.reason: This paper introduces the k-means++ initialization algorithm, which is crucial for the theoretical analysis and approximation guarantees of the mini-batch kernel k-means algorithm.

references.paper_title: Deterministic coresets for k-means of big sparse data
references.reason: This paper provides coreset constructions which are relevant to improving the efficiency of kernel k-means, which is discussed in the related work section.

references.paper_title: Mini-batch k-means terminates within O(d/e) iterations
references.reason: This paper is directly related to the proposed algorithm, providing theoretical guarantees for mini-batch k-means that are adapted and extended in the current work.

references.paper_title: A local search approximation algorithm for k-means clustering
references.reason: This paper provides a foundational understanding of the k-means algorithm and its approximation properties, which are relevant to the analysis of kernel k-means.

references.paper_title: Scalable kernel k-means clustering with nystrom approximation: Relative-error bounds
references.reason: This paper explores using Nystrom approximation to speed up kernel k-means, a technique that is related to the approach proposed in the current paper.
